name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: This lecture is about evaluation of text clustering.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: So far we have talked about multiple ways of doing text clustering but

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: how do we know which method works the best?

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: So this has to do with evaluation.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: Now to talk about evaluation one must

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: go back to the clustering bias that we introduced at the beginning.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _Because two objects can be similar depending on how you look at them

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: we must clearly specify the perspective of similarity.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _Without that
column6: the problem of clustering is not well defined. _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: So this perspective is also very important for evaluation.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _If you look at this slide

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _you can see we have two different ways to cluster these shapes

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _if you ask a question

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _You actually see
column6: there's no way to answer this question without knowing whether _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _we'd like to cluster based on shapes

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: And that's precisely why the perspective on clustering bias is

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: crucial for evaluation.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _In general
column6: we can evaluate text clusters in two ways

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _one is direct evaluation

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _So in direct evaluation

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _we want to answer the following questions

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: clusters to the ideal clusters that are generated by humans?

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: So the closeness here can be assessed

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: from multiple perspectives and that will help us characterize the quality

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _of cluster result in multiple angles

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: Now we also want to quantify the closeness because this would allow

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: us to easily compare different measures based on their performance figures.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _And finally
column8: we essentially inject the clustering bias _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _by using humans
column6: basically humans would bring in the the need or _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: desire to clustering bias.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _Now
column6: how do we do that exactly? _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _Well
column6: the general procedure would look like this. _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _Given a test set which consists of a lot of text objects

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _we can have humans to create the ideal clustering result

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: we're going to ask humans to partition the objects to create the gold standard.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: And they will use their judgments based on the need of a particular application

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _to generate what they think are the best clustering results

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: used to compare with the system generated clusters from the same test set.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _And ideally
column6: we want the system results to be the same as the human generated _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _results
column7: they are not going to be the same. _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: So we would like to then quantify the similarity between the system-generated

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: clusters and the gold standard clusters.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: And this similarity can also be measure from multiple perspectives and this will

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _give us various meshes to quantitatively evaluate a cluster

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _And some of the commonly used measures include the purity

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _a cluster has a similar object from the same cluster

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: And normalized mutual information is a commonly used measure

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: which basically measures based on the identity of

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: cluster of object in the system generally.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: How well can you predict the cluster of the object in the gold standard or

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: vice versa?

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _And mutual information captures
column6: the correlation between these cluster labels _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: and normalized mutual information is often

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: used for quantifying the similarity for

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _this evaluation purpose
column6: F measure is another possible measure. _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: Now again a thorough discussion of this evaluation and

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: these evaluation issues would be beyond the scope of this course.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: I've suggested some reading in the end that you can take a look

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: at to know more about that.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: So here I just want to discuss some high level ideas

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: that would allow you to think about how to do evaluation in your applications.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: The second way to evaluate text clusters is to do indirect evaluation.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _So in this case the question to answer is
column6: how useful are the clustering results for _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: the intended applications?

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _Now this of course is application specific question

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: usefulness is going to depend on specific applications.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _In this case
column6: the clustering bias is imposed by the independent application _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _as well

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: what counts as a best cluster result would be dependent on the application.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: Now procedure wise we also would create a test set with text objects for

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: the intended application to quantify the performance of the system.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _In this case
column6: what we care about is the contribution of _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: clustering to some application so we often have a baseline system to compare with.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _This could be the current system for doing something

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _then you hope to add a clustering to improve it

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: the baseline system could be using a different clustering method.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _And then what you are trying to experiment with

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: you hope to have better idea of word clustering.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _So in any case you have a baseline system work with
column6: and then you add a clustering _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: algorithm to the baseline system to produce a clustering system.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: And then we have to compare the performance of your clustering system and

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: the baseline system in terms of the performance measure for

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: that particular application.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: So in this case we call it indirect evaluation of clusters because there's no

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _explicit assessment of the quality of clusters

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: rather it's to assess the contribution of clusters to a particular application.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _So

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _it's a very useful unsupervised general text mining technique

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: it's particularly useful for obtaining an overall picture of the text content.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _And this is often needed to explore text data

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: this is often the first step when you deal with a lot of text data.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: The second application or second kind of applications is through

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: discover interesting clustering structures in text data and

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: these structures can be very meaningful.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: There are many approaches that can be used to form text clustering and

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: we discussed model based approaches and some narrative based approaches.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _In general
column6: strong clusters tend to show up no matter what method is used. _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: Also the effectiveness of a method highly depends on whether the desired

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _clustering bias is captured appropriately
column6: and this can be done either through using _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _the right generating model
column6: the model design appropriate for the clustering

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: the right similarity function expressly define the bias.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: Deciding the optimal number of customers is a very difficult problem for

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _order cluster methods
column6: and that's because it's unsupervised algorithm

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: and there's no training there how to guide us to select the best number of clusters.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: Now sometimes you may see some methods that can automatically determine

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _the number of clusters
column6: but in general that has some implied _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: application of clustering bias there and that's just not specified.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _Without clearly defining a clustering bias

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _the optimal number of cluster is what
column6: so this important to keep in mind. _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: And I should also say sometimes we can also use application to determine

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _the number of clusters

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _then obviously you don't want to generate the 100 clusters

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: the number can be dictated by the interface design.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _In other situations
column6: we might be able to use the fitness to data _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: to assess whether we've got a good number of clusters to explain our data well.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _And to do that
column6: you can vary the number of clusters and _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: watch how well you can fit the data.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: In general when you add a more components to a mixed model you should fit

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _the data better because you

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: you can always set the probability of using the new component as zero.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _So you can't in general fit the data worse than before

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: is as you add more components would you be able to significantly improve the fitness

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: of the data and that can be used to determine the right number of clusters.

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _And finally evaluation of clustering results

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: _this kind can be done both directly and indirectly
column6: and we often would like to _

name: 4 - 6 - 3.6 Text Clustering- Evaluation (00-10-11).srt
text: do both in order to get a good sense about how well our method works.
